review: I am unsure if it is my wifi, my apps or just the device - but a hard reset by unplugging it (even w/ latest firmware) still has to take place from time to time, otherwise it does what it says. Unfortunately, Google also got me for a $11/month Play subscription, so - after 2-3 months, I am really out $35 + 11 + 11 + 11, which as you can see, adds up quickly. review: I was under the impression that if you can watch it from chrome browser you could watch it on your HDtv through the chromecast.  This would be true if it wasn't for the necessary software player requirements on your nexus.  Apparently some videos require the use of a secondary video player software to be played.  This secondary software is no longer available for use on the nexus (yes it used to be available).  It is essentially a software hardware battle between companies.  Open source software really does shine when you encounter this type of chest bumping between the big corporations.Aside from the above....  The connectivity with the chromecast and the nexus seems very poor.  Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not.  I find it MUCH more simple to use my HDtv's web based apps to play what I want rather than using the Chromecast.  I have left the Chromecast in the TV's port but unplugged it.  I don't even use it.I will probably take it along when I go on a trip so it could be used in a  hotel or something.  Hope it works then.The good news is it wasn't that expensive.  So not  a big loss.
